Agent

class amber.agent.Agent(model: BaseModel, agent_id: int)[source]

Bases: BaseAgent

Base class for all agents in the simulation, using DataFrames for data storage.

__repr__()[source]

String representation of the agent.

get_data() → DataFrame[source]

Get this agent’s data from the model’s DataFrame.

Returns:

DataFrame containing this agent’s data

get_neighbors(condition: Expr | None = None) → DataFrame[source]

Get neighboring agents’ data based on a condition.

Parameters:

condition – Optional Polars expression to filter neighbors

Returns:

DataFrame containing neighboring agents’ data

record(name: str, value: Any)[source]

Record a variable value for this agent in the model’s DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • name – Name of the variable

  • value – Value to record

setup()[source]

Initialize agent attributes. Override this method in subclasses.

update_data(data: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Update this agent’s data in the model’s DataFrame.

Parameters:

data – Dictionary of column names and values to update

The Agent class represents individual entities in your simulation. Each agent has:

  • A unique ID within the model

  • Access to the model and its parameters

  • Ability to store custom attributes

  • Methods for interacting with other agents and the environment

Basic Usage

import amber as am

class MyAgent(am.Agent):
    def __init__(self, model, agent_id):
        super().__init__(model, agent_id)
        self.wealth = 10
        self.age = 0

    def step(self):
        # Define agent behavior
        self.age += 1
        # ... other behaviors

# In your model's setup():
agent = MyAgent(self, agent_id)
self.add_agent(agent)

Custom Agent Classes

You can create custom agent classes by inheriting from BaseAgent:

from amber.base import BaseAgent

class CustomAgent(BaseAgent):
    def __init__(self, model, agent_id):
        super().__init__(model, agent_id)
        self.custom_property = "value"

    def custom_method(self):
        # Your custom behavior
        pass

Agent Properties

Built-in Properties:

  • id - Unique identifier for the agent

  • model - Reference to the parent model

  • p - Shortcut to model parameters (model.p)

Custom Properties:

You can add any custom properties to agents by setting them as attributes:

agent.wealth = 100
agent.position = (5, 10)
agent.state = "active"
